intro: Andropterum, commonly known as the common hop, is a climbing plant belonging to the Cannabaceae family. It is characterized by its opposite, heart-shaped leaves and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in clusters. The plant produces a distinctive, aromatic resin that has been historically used in brewing beer. Its stems are often covered in fine hairs and can twine around supporting structures. Andropterum is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it thrives in moist, temperate environments.
